text:
The ruling Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) on Sunday said the Punjab government is exercising its “constitutional right” to bring a Bill in the State Assembly on Monday to denotify and return 5,376 acres of land acquired for construction of the SYL Canal to owners.

“It is our legal right as per the Constitution to bring a Bill in Vidhan Sabha and we are just exercising that right,” SAD spokesman Daljit Singh Cheema said.

“We are not doing anything unlawful by bringing the Bill in Vidhan Sabha,” he said.

Mr. Cheema said that the Punjab Satluj Yamuna Link Canal (Rehabilitation and Re-vesting of Proprietary Rights) Bill, 2016 will be tabled in the Assembly on Monday for passage. On political parties in Haryana requesting Governor Kaptan Singh Solanki not to give his assent to the Bill, the SAD spokesman said: “Governor has the constitutional duty to perform and we are using our legal right.”

Reacting sharply to the allegation that the Bill is “unconstitutional”, Mr. Cheema said: “The Bill cannot be termed as illegal or unconstitutional.”PTI
title: Punjab govt. move on SYL Canal not unlawful: SAD
